sub_topic: Determining the surface area of a cone.
message_1: A cone has a radius of 5 cm and a slant height of 12 cm. Find the surface area of the cone (rounded to the nearest hundredth).
message_2:
To find the surface area of a cone, we use the formula:

Surface Area = πr(r + l)

where r is the radius and l is the slant height.

In this case, r = 5 cm and l = 12 cm.

Surface Area = π(5)(5 + 12)
Surface Area = π(5)(17)
Surface Area = 85π

Now, we will approximate the value of π as 3.14:

Surface Area ≈ 85 * 3.14
Surface Area ≈ 267.1 cm²

So, the surface area of the cone is approximately 267.1 cm², rounded to the nearest hundredth.
